sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SCÆVOLA (C. Mucius), a young Roman of illuſtrious birth, is particularly celebrated in the Roman hiſtory for a brave but unſucceſsful attempt upon the life of Porſena king of Hetruria, about the year before Chriſt 504. See the article Rome, n o 71.

SCAEVOLA, in botany; a genus of the monogynia order, belonging to the pentandria claſs of plants. The corolla is monopetalous; the tube ſlit longitudinally; the border quinqueſid and lateral. The fruit is a plum inferior and monoſpermous; the nucleus bilocular.
